con:part.con:content: <wsdl:definitions name="EDLProvider" targetNamespace="http://temp/edlprovider" xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" xmlns:wsam="http://www.w3.org/2007/05/addressing/metadata" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/" xmlns:soap12="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap12/" xmlns:soapenc="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xmlns:wsaw="http://www.w3.org/2006/05/addressing/wsdl" xmlns:wsa="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2004/08/addressing" xmlns:bms="http://base.fims.tv" xmlns:tim="http://baseTime.fims.tv" xmlns:edlns="http://temp/edlprovider"> <wsdl:types> <schema targetNamespace="http://temp/edlprovider" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <include schemaLocation="EDLProvider.xsd"/> <element name="installedEdlsResponse" type="edlns:InstalledEdlsResponseType"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">This element provides the list of EDL types in the service together with the recommended extension types.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse"/> </annotation> </element> <element name="getEdlRequest" type="edlns:EdlCreateRequestType"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">This element represents the request made to create an EDL.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse"/> </annotation> </element> <element name="getEdlDoubleRequest" type="edlns:EdlCreateRequestDoubleType"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">This element represents the request made to create an EDL using a frame rate represented in floating point.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse"/> </annotation> </element> <element name="getEdlResponse" type="edlns:EdlCreateResponseType"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">This element represents the response when a EDL is created, containing the EDL contents.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse"/> </annotation> </element> <element name="edlProviderFault" type="edlns:EdlProviderFaultType"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">This element represents a fault that might occur when requesting EDL's from the service.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse"/> </annotation> </element> </schema> </wsdl:types> <wsdl:message name="getInstalledEdlsRequestMsg"></wsdl:message> <wsdl:message name="getInstalledEdlsResponseMsg"> <wsdl:part name="out" element="edlns:installedEdlsResponse"> <wsdl:documentation>This message provides the response to getting all the EDL types available in the service.</wsdl:documentation> </wsdl:part> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:message name="getEdlRequestMsg"> <wsdl:part name="out" element="edlns:getEdlRequest"> <wsdl:documentation>This message represents the request to create an EDL with a specific type.</wsdl:documentation> </wsdl:part> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:message name="getEdlResponseMsg"> <wsdl:part name="out" element="edlns:getEdlResponse"> <wsdl:documentation>This message provides the response to getting an EDL type from the service.</wsdl:documentation> </wsdl:part> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:message name="getEdlDoubleRequestMsg"> <wsdl:part name="out" element="edlns:getEdlDoubleRequest"> <wsdl:documentation>This message represents the request to create an EDL with a specific type.</wsdl:documentation> </wsdl:part> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:message name="getEdlDoubleResponseMsg"> <wsdl:part name="out" element="edlns:getEdlResponse"> <wsdl:documentation>This message provides the response to getting an EDL type from the service.</wsdl:documentation> </wsdl:part> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:message name="FaultMsg"> <wsdl:part name="fault" element="edlns:edlProviderFault"> <wsdl:documentation>This message represents a fault which might occur in the EDL service.</wsdl:documentation> </wsdl:part> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:portType name="EdlProviderService"> <wsdl:documentation>The EDLProvider SOAP interface provides a based on FIMS service for creating EDL's.</wsdl:documentation> <wsdl:operation name="getInstalledEdls"> <wsdl:documentation>This operation gets all the EDL types available in the service.</wsdl:documentation> <wsdl:input wsaw:Action="http://temp/edlprovider/getInstalledEdls" message="edlns:getInstalledEdlsRequestMsg"/> <wsdl:output wsaw:Action="http://temp/edlprovider/getInstalledEdlsResponse" message="edlns:getInstalledEdlsResponseMsg"/> <wsdl:fault name="fault" message="edlns:FaultMsg"/> </wsdl:operation> <wsdl:operation name="getEdl"> <wsdl:documentation>This operation gets all the edl types available in the service.</wsdl:documentation> <wsdl:input wsaw:Action="http://temp/edlprovider/getEdl" message="edlns:getEdlRequestMsg"/> <wsdl:output wsaw:Action="http://temp/edlprovider/getEdlResponse" message="edlns:getEdlResponseMsg"/> <wsdl:fault name="fault" message="edlns:FaultMsg"/> </wsdl:operation> <wsdl:operation name="getEdlDouble"> <wsdl:documentation>This operation gets all the EDL types available in the service.</wsdl:documentation> <wsdl:input wsaw:Action="http://temp/edlprovider/getEdlDouble" message="edlns:getEdlDoubleRequestMsg"/> <wsdl:output wsaw:Action="http://temp/edlprovider/getEdlDoubleResponse" message="edlns:getEdlDoubleResponseMsg"/> <wsdl:fault name="fault" message="edlns:FaultMsg"/> </wsdl:operation> </wsdl:portType> <wsdl:binding name="EdlProviderBinding" type="edlns:EdlProviderService"> <soap:binding transport="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/http"/> <wsdl:operation name="getInstalledEdls"> <soap:operation soapAction="http://temp/edlprovider/getInstalledEdls" style="document"/> <wsdl:input> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:input> <wsdl:output> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:output> <wsdl:fault name="fault"> <soap:fault use="literal" name="fault"/> </wsdl:fault> </wsdl:operation> <wsdl:operation name="getEdl"> <soap:operation soapAction="http://temp/edlprovider/getEdl" style="document"/> <wsdl:input> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:input> <wsdl:output> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:output> <wsdl:fault name="fault"> <soap:fault use="literal" name="fault"/> </wsdl:fault> </wsdl:operation> <wsdl:operation name="getEdlDouble"> <soap:operation soapAction="http://temp/edlprovider/getEdlDouble" style="document"/> <wsdl:input> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:input> <wsdl:output> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:output> <wsdl:fault name="fault"> <soap:fault use="literal" name="fault"/> </wsdl:fault> </wsdl:operation> </wsdl:binding> <wsdl:service name="EdlProviderService"> <wsdl:port name="EdlProviderService" binding="edlns:EdlProviderBinding"> <soap:address location="http://host/path/EDLProviderPort"/> </wsdl:port> </wsdl:service> </wsdl:definitions>

<xs:schema targetNamespace="http://temp/edlprovider" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:bms="http://base.fims.tv" xmlns:tim="http://baseTime.fims.tv" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:edlns="http://temp/edlprovider"> <xs:import namespace="http://base.fims.tv" schemaLocation="baseMediaService-V1_1_0.xsd"/> <xs:import namespace="http://baseTime.fims.tv" schemaLocation="baseTime-V1_1_0.xsd"/> <xs:complexType name="ArrayOfstring"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded" name="string" nillable="true" type="xs:string"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ArrayOfClips"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded" name="clips" type="edlns:ClipType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="ClipType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="markIn" type="tim:TimeType"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="markOut" type="tim:TimeType"/> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="clipInfo" type="bms:BMObjectType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:element name="Map"> <xs:complexType> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="item" type="edlns:MapItemType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:unique name="item"> <xs:selector xpath="item"/> <xs:field xpath="key"/> </xs:unique> </xs:element> <xs:complexType name="MapItemType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="edlType" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="edlExtension" type="xs:string"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!--**************************** Messages and faults ****************************--> <xs:complexType name="EdlCreateRequestBaseType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Represents the request to create a EDL for the specified type.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="edlType" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" type="xs:string" nillable="false"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">The EDL type to generate, the types available can be obtained using getInstalledEdls.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Mandatory</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Not applicable</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element name="clips" minOccurs="0" type="edlns:ArrayOfClips" nillable="true"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">List of clips to include in the created EDL.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Mandatory</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Not applicable</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="edlSequenceName" nillable="true" type="xs:string"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">The EDL sequence name. This might mean something different in different EDL's.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Mandatory</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Not applicable</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EdlCreateRequestType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Represents the request to create a EDL for the specified type and frame rate.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="edlns:EdlCreateRequestBaseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="edlFramesPerSecond" type="bms:RationalType" nillable="false"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">The EDL frames per second.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Mandatory</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Not applicable</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EdlCreateRequestDoubleType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Represents the request to create a EDL for the specified type and frame rate.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="edlns:EdlCreateRequestBaseType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" name="edlFramesPerSecond" type="xs:double" nillable="false"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">The EDL frames per second.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Mandatory</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Not applicable</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EdlCreateResponseType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Represents the response when an EDL is created.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:sequence> <xs:element minOccurs="0" name="getEdlResult" nillable="true" type="xs:base64Binary"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">The EDL data contents.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Not applicable</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Mandatory</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="InstalledEdlsResponseType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Represents the response when checking which EDL types are available in the service.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:sequence> <xs:element ref="edlns:Map"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A key/pair value of EDL types together with their recommended file extension. The extensions can be different than the recommended, but some programs will not be able to import the files.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Not applicable</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Mandatory</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="EdlProviderFaultType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Fault information for the EDL provider service.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement">If an exception is generated when the an EDL request message is submitted to the service, it shall respond with a message based on the EdlProviderFaultType.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexContent> <xs:extension base="bms:FaultType"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="extendedCode" type="edlns:EdlProviderErrorCodeType" minOccurs="0"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">EDL provider service-specific error codes as detailed in EdlProviderErrorCodeType.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement">This element shall be set if the service needs to provide service-specific error codes which are not specified in the fault 'code' element. In this case, the code element shall be set to 'EXT_S00_0000' and the extendedCode shall be set to one of the codes described in EdlProviderErrorCodeType. If the 'code'; element is set to any other value than 'EXT_S00_0000'; then this element shall not be set.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Not applicable</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Optional</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:extension> </xs:complexContent> </xs:complexType> <!--**************************** FIMS-defined enumerations ****************************--> <xs:simpleType name="EdlProviderErrorCodeType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Specific error codes for the EDL provider service, possible errors: - INF_S00_xxxx: Infrastructure errors (system, storage, network, memory, processor) - DAT_S00_xxxx: Data errors (validation, missing, duplication) - SVC_S00_xxxx: Operation errors (existence, support, lock, connection, failure) - SEC_S00_xxxx: Security errors (authentication, authorization) - EXT_S00_xxxx: Extended code.</xs:documentation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="EXT_S00_0001"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">EDL type not found.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> <xs:enumeration value="EXT_S00_0002"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Frame rate not supported.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:enumeration> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:schema>

See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License.--> <schema targetNamespace="http://base.fims.tv" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:bms="http://base.fims.tv" xmlns:desc="http://description.fims.tv" xmlns:tim="http://baseTime.fims.tv"> <import namespace="http://description.fims.tv" schemaLocation="description-V1_1_0.xsd"/> <import namespace="http://baseTime.fims.tv" schemaLocation="baseTime-V1_1_0.xsd"/> <!--****************************** FIMS Current Version ******************************--> <simpleType name="CurrentVersion"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">This schema type reports the current version of the Base Media Service schema for Clients to use to determine the current feature set.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_1_0</documentation> </annotation> <restriction base="string"> <enumeration value="1_1_0"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">This is the current FIMS version. Clients should use this value when determining what features are available in this version.</documentation> </annotation> </enumeration> </restriction> </simpleType> <!--****************************** Extension Types ******************************--> <complexType name="ExtensionGroup"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Each Type includes an ExtensionGroup to allow for vendor-specific extensions, but the definition is out of scope of the FIMS specification.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> </annotation> <sequence> <any namespace="##other" processContents="lax" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Any number of extension elements from an external namespace. The lax processing model indicates that if the schema for the extension elements is known, then they should be validated. If the schema is not known, no error will be generated. Extension nodes must be the last element in a sequence of a non-abstract type.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Inclusion In Request: Optional</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Inclusion In Response: Optional</documentation> </annotation> </any> </sequence> </complexType> <complexType name="ExtensionAttributes"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Each Type includes an ExtensionAttributes to allow for vendor-specific extensions, but the definition is out of scope of the FIMS specification.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> </annotation> <anyAttribute namespace="##other" processContents="lax"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Permitted extensions to elements that permit extensions. Attributes from other namespaces are permitted. Lax processing requests that a validator checks the attributes where access to the attribute's defining schema is available.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement">Extension attributes should not be used where an equivalent property is available in the FIMS data model. Attributes from the FIMS base namespace shall not be used.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Inclusion In Request: Optional</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Inclusion In Response: Optional</documentation> </annotation> </anyAttribute> </complexType> <!--****************************** FIMS-Defined References ******************************--> <complexType name="ResourceReferenceType"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">The source or target of a reference to a distinct resource. Resources include queues, jobs, assets, descriptions, formats, and profiles.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> </annotation> <sequence> <element name="resourceID" type="bms:ResourceIDType" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Locally distinct identifier for the resource that can be used to make reference to the resource. The reference may also be globally unique.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Inclusion In Request: Mandatory</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Inclusion In Response: Mandatory</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="revisionID" type="bms:RevisionIDType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Identifier for the specific revision of the resource. Tracking the different versions of resources across systems enables different instances and versions of a resource to coexist at different locations and updated to be eventually consistent according to local policy.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement">A reference to a resource that omits the revision identification of the resource shall indicate that the latest version is required.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription">Service Description: Required</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription">Description: Support or not.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Inclusion In Request: Optional</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Inclusion In Response: Optional</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="location" type="anyURI" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A Uniform Resource Location that points to a specific instance of a resource at a location.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement">Reference to a resource that omits the location shall require resolution of the resourceID according to local policy.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription">Service Description: Required</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription">Description: Support or not.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Inclusion In Request: Optional</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Inclusion In Response: Optional</documentation> </annotation> </element> </sequence> </complexType> <!--****************************** FIMS-Defined Resources ******************************--> <complexType name="ResourceType" abstract="true"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Resources include queues, jobs, assets, descriptions, formats, and profiles.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> </annotation> <complexContent> <extension base="bms:ResourceReferenceType"> <sequence> <element name="resourceCreationDate" type="dateTime" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Date and time when this resource was created.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Inclusion In Request: Optional</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Inclusion In Response: Optional</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="resourceModifiedDate" type="dateTime" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Date and time when this resource was last modified. It is recommended that a basic description of the content items is included by making use of the FIMS description metadata schema (http://description.fims.tv), which is based on a subset of descriptive metadata fields from EBUCore and Dublin Core. This will be useful for interoperable monitoring applications by providing a consistent place where, say, a title field can be found for presentation in a GUI. Content items may have many different descriptions for different purposes, such as for archiving, presentation, rights management and contributor management. For this purpose, the use of multiple descriptions in included. Also, a programme may be an episode that is part of a series that is part of a brand and the descriptions of each level in that hierarchy could be included (by reference) here.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement">At least one description of a logical content item should be provided. The URL covers different protocol schemes, such as NFS mounts RFC2224, which defines nfs://[host]:[port]/[directory].../[filename], and the internet draft for the smb: scheme for CIFS, with the restriction that only the path and not the file name shall be provided.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription">Service Description: Required</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription">Description: Kinds of destination supported.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Inclusion In Request: Mandatory</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Inclusion In Response: Mandatory</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="ExtensionGroup" type="bms:ExtensionGroup" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Extension point.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse"/> </annotation> </element> <element name="ExtensionAttributes" type="bms:ExtensionAttributes" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Extension point.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse"/> </annotation> </element> </sequence> </complexType> <complexType name="TransformAtomType"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Parameters specific to the transform media service that can be re-used by other services. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License.--> <schema targetNamespace="http://description.fims.tv" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:desc="http://description.fims.tv" xmlns:tim="http://baseTime.fims.tv"> <import namespace="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace" schemaLocation="xml.xsd"/> <import namespace="http://baseTime.fims.tv" schemaLocation="baseTime-V1_1_0.xsd"/> <element name="bmContentDescription" type="desc:bmContentDescriptionType"/> <complexType name="bmContentDescriptionType"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">The body of descriptive metadata</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_0_7</documentation> </annotation> <sequence> <element name="title" type="desc:textElementType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A Title is the main name given to a resource e.g. an editorial object. It corresponds for a series to the series title, for programme to the programme title, for an item to the item title, etc. Titles are recorded as they appear. The Title is the name by which a resource is formally known and that everyone should use to refer to or search for that particular resource. The Title may be provided in several languages.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_0_7</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="alternativeTitle" type="desc:titleType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">An Alternative Title is the name other than the main Title given to a resource. The type of title is defined by the typeGroup of attributes. Alternative Titles are recorded as they appear. An Alternative Title may be attributed to a resource for several reasons described using the type (e.g. series title) attributes. The alternativeTitle may be provided in several languages.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_0_7</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="creator" type="desc:entityType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">The descriptor creator identifies an entity (a person, group of persons or organisation) primarily responsible for creating the content of the resource - behind the camera. Different roles may be considered as representing a creator, e.g. a producer, an author, etc. Creator is a sub-class of Contributor.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_0_7</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="subject" type="desc:subjectType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">The generalised topic that represents the intellectual content of the resource. Typically, a subject is expressed by keywords, key phrases. Free text, controlled vocabularies, authorities, or formal classification schemes (codes) may be employed when selecting descriptive subject terms. Persons as subjects are also placed here.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_0_7</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="description" type="desc:descriptionType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Free-form text or a narrative to report general notes, abstracts, or summaries about the intellectual content of a resource.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_0_7</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="publisher" type="desc:entityType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A publisher is a person, an organization, or a service. Typically, the name of a Publisher should be used to indicate the entity primarily responsible for distributing or making a resource available to others e.g. by broadcasting, selling, leasing, renting and other modes of distribution.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_0_7</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="contributor" type="desc:entityType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">The descriptor contributor identifies a person or organization that has made substantial creative contributions to the content of a resource. Refers particularly (but not only) to participation in front of the camera. If in doubt whether an entity is a creator or contributor use the element contributor.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_0_7</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="date" type="desc:dateType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Dates associated with events occurring during the life of the resource. Typically, Date will be associated with the creation, modification or availability of the resource.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_0_7</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="type" type="desc:typeType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">The nature or genre of the editorial object. Type includes terms describing general categories, functions, genres, or aggregation levels for content. Recommended best practice is to select a value from a controlled vocabulary.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_0_7</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="identifier" type="desc:identifierType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A unique, unambiguous reference or identifier for a resource within a given context. Best practice is to identify the resource (whether analogue or digital) by means of a string or number corresponding to an established or formal identification system if one exists. Otherwise, use an identification method that is in use within your agency, station, production company, office, or institution. It is also possible to enter more than one, different but still unique, identifier for the same resource.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_0_7</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="language" type="desc:languageType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Identifies languages and their use in the intellectual content of the resource. Recommended best practice for the values of the Language element is defined by RFC 5646. It is recommended to use a two-letter Language Code (taken from the ISO Standard 639), followed optionally, by a two-letter Country Code (taken from the ISO Standard 3166) preferably expressed using capitals letters. For example, 'en' for English, 'fr' for French, or 'en-UK' for English used in the United Kingdom. More contextual information can be provided using the note attribute.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_0_7</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="relation" type="desc:relationType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Recommended best practice is to reference the resource (to which the current resource under description is related) by means of a string or number conforming to a formal identification system. Relation is used to show the relation in content to another resource. For example, "IsPartOf" is used to show the relation between a part of a radio programme and the whole programme or between a track and a record album. A resource can be identified by its title, or an identifier (possibly a URI). The related item has its own separate metadata record. Relation is used to provide a name, an identification number or ID, or a locator where the related item can be found.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_1_0</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="isVersionOf" type="desc:relationType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A reference to the resource that the current resource is a version of</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_1_0</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="hasVersion" type="desc:relationType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A reference to another version of the resource</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_1_0</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="isReplacedBy" type="desc:relationType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A reference to a resource replacing the current resource</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_1_0</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="replaces" type="desc:relationType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A reference to a resource that the current resource replaces</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_1_0</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="isRequiredBy" type="desc:relationType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A reference to a resource requiring the current resource</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_1_0</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="requires" type="desc:relationType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A reference to a resource that the current resource requires</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_1_0</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="isPartOf" type="desc:relationType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A reference to a resource that the current resource is a part of</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_1_0</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="hasPart" type="desc:relationType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A reference to a resource that forms part of the current resource</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_1_0</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="isReferencedBy" type="desc:relationType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A reference to a resource that references the current resource</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_1_0</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="references" type="desc:relationType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A reference to a resource that the current resource references</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_1_0</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="isFormatOf" type="desc:relationType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A reference to a resource with which the current resource shares a format</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_1_0</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="hasFormat" type="desc:relationType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A format in which the resource is also available</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_1_0</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="isEpisodeOf" type="desc:relationType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A reference to a series the current resource is an episode of</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_1_0</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="isMemberOf" type="desc:relationType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A reference to a group e.g. a brand, the current resource is an member of</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_1_0</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="hasMembers" type="desc:relationType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A reference to members of a group</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_1_0</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="coverage" type="desc:coverageType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Coverage is used to show various time and place aspects of the subject of the content. Coverage will typically include spatial location (a place name or geographic coordinates), temporal period (a period label, date, or date range) or jurisdiction (such as a named administrative entity). Recommended best practice is to select a value from a controlled vocabulary (for example, the Thesaurus of Geographic Names) and that, where appropriate, named places or time periods be used in preference to numeric identifiers such as sets of coordinates or date ranges.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_0_7</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="rights" type="desc:rightsType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">An all-purpose field to identify information (rights management statement or reference to a service providing such information e.g. via a URL) about copyright, intellectual property rights or other property rights held in and over a resource, stating whether access is open or restricted in some way. If dates, times, territories and availability periods are associated with a right, they should be included. If the Rights element is absent, no assumptions can be made about the status of these and other rights with respect to the resource.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_0_7</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="version" type="string" minOccurs="0"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">UK Version, US Version, home video version, etc. Mapping to Dublin Core would be made using a description element. There can be mutiple type of version references.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_0_7</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="part" type="desc:partType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">To identify parts or segments within the editorial object, such as changes in the topic of a magasine programme</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:introducedInVersion">Introduced In Version: 1_1_0</documentation> </annotation> </element> </sequence> <attribute ref="xml:lang"/> </complexType> <complexType name="titleType"> <complexContent> <extension base="desc:textElementType"> <attributeGroup ref="desc:typeGroup"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType> <complexType name="coverageType"> <sequence> <element name="temporal" minOccurs="0"> <complexType> <complexContent> <extension base="desc:textElementType"> <attributeGroup ref="desc:typeGroup"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType> </element> <element name="spatial" minOccurs="0"> <complexType> <sequence> <element name="locationName"> <complexType> <complexContent> <extension base="desc:textElementType"> <attributeGroup ref="desc:typeGroup"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType> </element> <element name="coordinates" minOccurs="0"> <annotation> <documentation>Optional geospatial coordinates. 'posy' is the latitude. 'posx' is the longitude. Both are expressed in digital degrees</documentation> </annotation> <complexType> <sequence> <element name="posy" type="float"/> <element name="posx" type="float"/> </sequence> <attributeGroup ref="desc:formatGroup"/> </complexType> </element> </sequence> </complexType> </element> </sequence> </complexType> <complexType name="rightsType"> <sequence> <element name="rightsExpression" type="desc:textElementType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <element name="rightsLink" type="anyURI" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="rightsHolder" type="desc:entityType" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="exploitationIssues" type="desc:textElementType" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="coverage" type="desc:coverageType" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="rightsClearanceFlag" type="boolean" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="disclaimer" type="desc:textElementType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <element name="rightsId" type="desc:identifierType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> name="textElementType"> <simpleContent> <extension base="string"> <attribute ref="xml:lang"/> </extension> </simpleContent> </complexType> <complexType name="dateType"> <sequence> <element minOccurs="0"> <complexType> <attributeGroup ref="desc:dateGroup"/> <attributeGroup ref="desc:typeGroup"/> </complexType> </element> </sequence> </complexType> <complexType name="entityType"> maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <element name="role" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <complexType> <attributeGroup ref="desc:typeGroup"/> </complexType> </element> </sequence> <attribute name="entityId" type="anyURI"/> </complexType> <complexType name="contactDetailsType"> <sequence> <choice> <element name="name" type="string"/> <sequence> <element name="givenName" type="string" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="familyName" type="string" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="otherGivenName" type="string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <element name="suffix" type="string" minOccurs="0"/> maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation>For example, in the case the contact is a performing actor/actress, the stage name will be the fictitious character's name</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="relatedContacts" type="desc:entityType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation>This is used to identify contacts related to the contact being described</documentation> </annotation> </element> </sequence> <attribute name="contactId" type="anyURI"/> <attributeGroup ref="desc:typeGroup"/> </complexType> <complexType name="organisationDetailsType"> <sequence> <element name="organisationName" type="desc:textElementType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation>The organisation name is optional as an organisation maybe identified by its OrganisationId</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="organisationCode" type="anyURI" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <element name="organisationDepartment" minOccurs="0"> <annotation> <documentation>To identify one or more production area / department / service where the resource was created/originated, in free text</documentation> </annotation> <complexType> <complexContent> <extension base="desc:textElementType"> <attribute name="departmentId" type="anyURI"/> </extension> </complexContent> </complexType> </element> <element name="details" type="desc:detailsType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <element name="contacts" type="desc:entityType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation>Useful to provide contact information particularly is no other person information is otherwise provided.</documentation> </annotation> </element> </sequence> <attribute name="organisationId" type="anyURI"/> <attributeGroup ref="desc:typeGroup"/> </complexType> <complexType name="detailsType"> <sequence> <element name="emailAddress" type="string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <annotation> <documentation>The e-mail address through which the contact can be directly accessed</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="webAddress" type="string" minOccurs="0"> <annotation> <documentation>The web address where additional information can be found regarding the company</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="address" type="desc:addressType" minOccurs="0"> <annotation> <documentation>The organisation address is also the professional address of the contact in the context of the content being described and in relation to the contact occupation provided in the contact details</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="telephoneNumber" type="string" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="mobileTelephoneNumber" type="string" minOccurs="0"/> </sequence> <attributeGroup ref="desc:typeGroup"/> </complexType> <complexType name="addressType"> <annotation> <documentation xml:lang="EN">Provides address details for an organisation</documentation> </annotation> <sequence> <element name="addressLine" type="desc:textElementType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <element name="addressTownCity" type="desc:textElementType" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="addressCountyState" type="desc:textElementType" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="addressDeliveryCode" type="string" minOccurs="0"/> <element name="country" minOccurs="0"> <complexType> <attributeGroup ref="desc:typeGroup"/> </complexType> </element> </sequence> </complexType> <complexType name="languageType"> <attributeGroup ref="desc:typeGroup"/> <attribute ref="xml:lang"/> </complexType> <complexType name="relationType"> <sequence> <element name="relationIdentifier" ref="desc:typeGroup"/> <attribute name="runningOrderNumber" type="integer"> <annotation> <documentation>If exists, it provides the ranking/running order within an ordered list.</documentation> <xs:schema targetNamespace="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace" xml:lang="en" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This schema defines attributes and an attribute group that enable schemas to allow xml:base, xml:lang or xml:space attributes on elements they define.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>See http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace.html and http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml for information about this namespace.
This schema document describes the XML namespace, in a form suitable for import by other schema documents.
Note that local names in this namespace are intended to be defined only by the World Wide Web Consortium or its subgroups. The following names are currently defined in this namespace and should not be used with conflicting semantics by any Working Group, specification, or document instance:
base (as an attribute name): denotes an attribute whose value provides a URI to be used as the base for interpreting any relative URIs in the scope of the element on which it appears; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML Base specification.
lang (as an attribute name): denotes an attribute whose value is a language code for the natural language of the content of any element; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML specification.
space (as an attribute name): denotes an attribute whose value is a keyword indicating what whitespace processing discipline is intended for the content of the element; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML specification.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This schema defines attributes and an attribute group suitable for use by schemas wishing to allow xml:base, xml:lang or xml:space attributes on elements they define.
To enable this, such a schema must import this schema for the XML namespace, e.g. as follows: <schema . . .> . . . <import namespace="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace" schemaLocation="http://www.w3.org/2001/03/xml.xsd"/>
Subsequently, qualified reference to any of the attributes or the group defined below will have the desired effect, e.g.
<type . . .> . . . <attributeGroup ref="xml:specialAttrs"/>
will define a type which will schema-validate an instance element with any of those attributes</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>In keeping with the XML Schema WG's standard versioning policy, this schema document will persist at http://www.w3.org/2004/10/xml.xsd. At the date of issue it can also be found at http://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd. The schema document at that URI may however change in the future, in order to remain compatible with the latest version of XML Schema itself, or with the XML namespace itself. In other words, if the XML Schema or XML namespaces change, the version of this document at http://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd will change accordingly; the version at http://www.w3.org/2004/10/xml.xsd will not change.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="lang" type="xs:language"/> <xs:attribute name="space"> <xs:simpleType> <xs:restriction base="xs:NCName"> <xs:enumeration value="default"/> <xs:enumeration value="preserve"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:attribute> <xs:attribute name="base" type="xs:anyURI"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>See http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlbase/ for information about this attribute.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> </xs:attribute> <xs:attributeGroup name="specialAttrs"> <xs:attribute ref="xml:base"/> <xs:attribute ref="xml:lang"/> <xs:attribute ref="xml:space"/> </xs:attributeGroup> </xs:schema>

Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License.--> <schema targetNamespace="http://baseTime.fims.tv" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:tim="http://baseTime.fims.tv"> <!--****************************** FIMS-defined simple types ******************************--> <simpleType name="Timecode"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A SMPTE ST 12-1 timecode value formatted according to the edit decision list grammar specified in SMPTE ST 258. In this grammar, the punctuation character between the seconds and frames of the timecode indicates whether the timecode is a drop frame or non drop frame timecode, e.g. 10:11:12;13 is a drop frame timecode value and 10:11:12:13 is a non-drop frame timecode value.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> </annotation> <restriction base="string"> <pattern value="(([0-1][0-9])|([2][0-3])):[0-5][0-9]:[0-5][0-9](([.,])|([:;]))[0-2][0-9]"/> </restriction> </simpleType> <simpleType name="TimecodeDuration"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A representation of AV duration as a SMPTE timecode-like value, with an upper bound of 99 hours rather than 23 hours.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> </annotation> <restriction base="string"> <pattern value="[0-9][0-9]:[0-5][0-9]:[0-5][0-9](([.,])|([:;]))[0-2][0-9]"/> </restriction> </simpleType> <!--****************************** FIMS-defined complex types for representing single values ******************************--> <complexType name="DurationType"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Measure of the duration of an operation or item of content.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement">One of the elements shall be used.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription">Service Description: Required</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription">Element(s) supported.</documentation> </annotation> <choice> <element name="timecode" type="tim:TimecodeDuration" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Duration of AV content in a timecode-like format (e.g. SMPTE ST 12-1) as defined in EBU Tech 3293.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement">This kind of duration shall be used only where an exact time can be calculated from the timecode value. For example, it is not appropriate for NTSC systems.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Inclusion In Request: Mandatory</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Inclusion In Response: Mandatory</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="normalPlayTime" type="duration" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A duration expressed using usual time representation as in RFC 2326 and ISO 8601 (e.g.:PT1H31M25.152S)</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Inclusion In Request: Mandatory</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Inclusion In Response: Mandatory</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="editUnitNumber" type="tim:EditUnitNumberType" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A duration expressed as a number of edit units, as defined in EBU Tech 3293.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Inclusion In Request: Mandatory</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Inclusion In Response: Mandatory</documentation> </annotation> </element> </choice> </complexType> <complexType name="TimeType"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Value used to represent a point in time, such as at what time to start an operation.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement">One of the elements shall be used.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription">Service Description: Required</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription">Element(s) supported.</documentation> </annotation> <choice> <element name="timecode" type="tim:Timecode" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Start time expressed using timecode values compliant with SMPTE ST 12-1.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Inclusion In Request: Mandatory</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Inclusion In Response: Mandatory</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="normalPlayTime" type="time" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Start time expressed by time of day in the format hh:mm:ss.sss with an optional following time zone indicator.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Inclusion In Request: Mandatory</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Inclusion In Response: Mandatory</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="editUnitNumber" type="tim:EditUnitNumberType" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">Start time expressed as a number of edit units.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Inclusion In Request: Mandatory</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Inclusion In Response: Mandatory</documentation> </annotation> </element> </choice> </complexType> <complexType name="EditUnitNumberType"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">A number of edit units as defined in EBU Tech 3293. An editUnit is the inverse of the edit rate, or corrected edit rate as the result of editUnit=1/(editrate*(factorNumerator/factorDenominator)). See EBU Tech 3293 for more information.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> </annotation> <simpleContent> <extension base="long"> <attribute name="editRate" type="positiveInteger" use="required"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">The base number of frames or samples per seconds. This base number can be corrected by a factor calculated as the product of the edit rate and 'factorNumerator/factorDenominator'.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Inclusion In Request: Mandatory</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Inclusion In Response: Mandatory</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="factorNumerator" type="positiveInteger" use="required"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">The numerator of the correction factor.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Inclusion In Request: Mandatory</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Inclusion In Response: Mandatory</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="factorDenominator" type="positiveInteger" use="required"> <annotation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:description">The denominator of the correction factor.</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:normativeRequirement"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:serviceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:contentOfServiceDescription"/> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInRequest">Inclusion In Request: Mandatory</documentation> <documentation source="urn:x-fims:inclusionInResponse">Inclusion In Response: Mandatory</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> </extension> </simpleContent> </complexType> </schema>
